page.title: 15HOWARD DAVIS PARK,ST.HELIER
page.content: This park is situated in St.Helier not far from the sea.It was founded by T.B. Davis and opened in 1938 in honour of his son Howard, who died at Etables in 1916. The most striking feature of the park must be the bronze statue of George V just outside the main entrance.It opens out onto a large lawn on which people can relax, sunbathe or listen to concerts from the bandstand which is frequently in use during the summer. Flower shows are also held in the park. Around the lawn itself winding pathways, surrounded by bushes lead you past exotic flowers into rose gardens, in which fountains and ponds can be found. All plants are tended daily and its immaculate appearance contributes to the popularity of the park.
